alert.note: Alert for Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 10:42PM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Pembroke, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Quinby, Black Creek Nr Hartsville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lumber River Near Lumberton. * WHEN...From Sunday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Low land flooding will occur along the river. The flood waters may affect some residential property as water backs up into the drainage ditches in the city. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:05 AM EST Saturday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 14.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lumber River Lumberton 13.0 12.1 Sat 7 am EST 14.0 13.7 13.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning.
